members.name: propertyChange
members.comment: Track changes to selection model, column model, etc. so as to be able to re-place listeners on those in order to pass on information to the Accessibility PropertyChange mechanism

param: e - A PropertyChangeEvent object describing the event source and the property that has changed.

members.name: tableChanged
members.comment: Track changes to the table contents

members.name: tableRowsInserted
members.comment: Track changes to the table contents (row insertions)

members.name: tableRowsDeleted
members.comment: Track changes to the table contents (row deletions)

members.name: columnAdded
members.comment: Track changes to the table contents (column insertions)

members.name: columnRemoved
members.comment: Track changes to the table contents (column deletions)

members.name: columnMoved
members.comment: Track changes of a column repositioning.

members.name: columnMarginChanged
members.comment: Track changes of a column moving due to margin changes.

members.name: columnSelectionChanged
members.comment: Track that the selection model of the TableColumnModel changed.

members.name: editingStopped
members.comment: Track changes to a cell's contents. Invoked when editing is finished. The changes are saved, the editor object is discarded, and the cell is rendered once again.

param: e - the ChangeEvent containing the source of the event

members.name: editingCanceled
members.comment: Invoked when editing is canceled. The editor object is discarded and the cell is rendered once again.

param: e - the ChangeEvent containing the source of the event

members.name: valueChanged
members.comment: Track changes to table cell selections

param: e - the event that characterizes the change.

members.name: getAccessibleSelection
members.comment: Get the AccessibleSelection associated with this object. In the implementation of the Java Accessibility API for this class, return this object, which is responsible for implementing the AccessibleSelection interface on behalf of itself.

return: this object

members.name: getAccessibleRole
members.comment: Gets the role of this object.

return: an instance of AccessibleRole describing the role of the object

members.name: getAccessibleAt
members.comment: Returns the Accessible child, if one exists, contained at the local coordinate Point.

param: p - the point defining the top-left corner of the Accessible, given in the coordinate space of the object's parent
return: the Accessible, if it exists, at the specified location; else null

members.name: getAccessibleChildrenCount
members.comment: Returns the number of accessible children in the object. If all of the children of this object implement Accessible, then this method should return the number of children of this object.

return: the number of accessible children in the object

members.name: getAccessibleChild
members.comment: Returns the nth Accessible child of the object.

return: the nth Accessible child of the object

members.name: getAccessibleSelectionCount
members.comment: Returns the number of Accessible children currently selected. If no children are selected, the return value will be 0.

return: the number of items currently selected

members.name: getAccessibleSelection
members.comment: Returns an Accessible representing the specified selected child in the object. If there isn't a selection, or there are fewer children selected than the integer passed in, the return value will be null. Note that the index represents the i-th selected child, which is different from the i-th child.

param: i - the zero-based index of selected children
return: the i-th selected child

members.name: isAccessibleChildSelected
members.comment: Determines if the current child of this object is selected.

param: i - the zero-based index of the child in this Accessible object
return: true if the current child of this object is selected

members.name: addAccessibleSelection
members.comment: Adds the specified Accessible child of the object to the object's selection. If the object supports multiple selections, the specified child is added to any existing selection, otherwise it replaces any existing selection in the object. If the specified child is already selected, this method has no effect. This method only works on JTables which have individual cell selection enabled.

param: i - the zero-based index of the child

members.name: removeAccessibleSelection
members.comment: Removes the specified child of the object from the object's selection. If the specified item isn't currently selected, this method has no effect. This method only works on JTables which have individual cell selection enabled.

param: i - the zero-based index of the child

members.name: clearAccessibleSelection
members.comment: Clears the selection in the object, so that no children in the object are selected.

members.name: selectAllAccessibleSelection
members.comment: Causes every child of the object to be selected, but only if the JTable supports multiple selections, and if individual cell selection is enabled.

members.name: getAccessibleRow
members.comment: Returns the row number of an index in the table.

param: index - the zero-based index in the table
return: the zero-based row of the table if one exists; otherwise -1.

members.name: getAccessibleColumn
members.comment: Returns the column number of an index in the table.

param: index - the zero-based index in the table
return: the zero-based column of the table if one exists; otherwise -1.

members.name: getAccessibleIndex
members.comment: Returns the index at a row and column in the table.

return: the zero-based index in the table if one exists; otherwise -1.

members.name: getAccessibleTable
members.comment: Gets the AccessibleTable associated with this object. In the implementation of the Java Accessibility API for this class, return this object, which is responsible for implementing the AccessibleTables interface on behalf of itself.

return: this object

members.name: getAccessibleCaption
members.comment: Returns the caption for the table.

return: the caption for the table

members.name: setAccessibleCaption
members.comment: Sets the caption for the table.

members.name: getAccessibleSummary
members.comment: Returns the summary description of the table.

return: the summary description of the table

members.name: setAccessibleSummary
members.comment: Sets the summary description of the table.

param: a - the summary description of the table

members.name: getAccessibleRowCount
members.comment: Description copied from interface: AccessibleTable

return: the number of rows in the table

members.name: getAccessibleColumnCount
members.comment: Description copied from interface: AccessibleTable

return: the number of columns in the table

members.name: getAccessibleAt
members.comment: Description copied from interface: AccessibleTable

return: the Accessible at the specified row and column

members.name: getAccessibleRowExtentAt
members.comment: Returns the number of rows occupied by the Accessible at a specified row and column in the table.

return: the number of rows occupied by the Accessible at a specified row and column in the table

members.name: getAccessibleColumnExtentAt
members.comment: Returns the number of columns occupied by the Accessible at a given (row, column).

return: the number of columns occupied by the Accessible at a specified row and column in the table

members.name: getAccessibleRowHeader
members.comment: Returns the row headers as an AccessibleTable.

return: an AccessibleTable representing the row headers

members.name: setAccessibleRowHeader
members.comment: Sets the row headers as an AccessibleTable.

members.name: getAccessibleColumnHeader
members.comment: Returns the column headers as an AccessibleTable.

return: an AccessibleTable representing the column headers, or null if the table header is null

members.name: setAccessibleColumnHeader
members.comment: Sets the column headers as an AccessibleTable.

members.name: getAccessibleRowDescription
members.comment: Returns the description of the specified row in the table.

return: the description of the row

members.name: setAccessibleRowDescription
members.comment: Sets the description text of the specified row of the table.

members.name: getAccessibleColumnDescription
members.comment: Returns the description of the specified column in the table.

return: the description of the column

members.name: setAccessibleColumnDescription
members.comment: Sets the description text of the specified column of the table.

members.name: isAccessibleSelected
members.comment: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the accessible at a given (row, column) is selected.

return: the boolean value true if the accessible at (row, column) is selected; otherwise, the boolean value false

members.name: isAccessibleRowSelected
members.comment: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the specified row is selected.

return: the boolean value true if the specified row is selected; otherwise, false

members.name: isAccessibleColumnSelected
members.comment: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the specified column is selected.

return: the boolean value true if the specified column is selected; otherwise, false

members.name: getSelectedAccessibleRows
members.comment: Returns the selected rows in a table.

return: an array of selected rows where each element is a zero-based row of the table

members.name: getSelectedAccessibleColumns
members.comment: Returns the selected columns in a table.

return: an array of selected columns where each element is a zero-based column of the table

members.name: getAccessibleRowAtIndex
members.comment: Returns the row at a given index into the table.

return: the row at a given index

members.name: getAccessibleColumnAtIndex
members.comment: Returns the column at a given index into the table.

return: the column at a given index

members.name: getAccessibleIndexAt
members.comment: Returns the index at a given (row, column) in the table.

return: the index into the table

members.comment: AccessibleJTable constructor

name: javax.swing.JTable$AccessibleJTable
comment:
This class implements accessibility support for the JTable class. It provides an implementation of the Java Accessibility API appropriate to table user-interface elements.

Warning: Serialized objects of this class will not be compatible with future Swing releases. The current serialization support is appropriate for short term storage or RMI between applications running the same version of Swing. As of 1.4, support for long term storage of all JavaBeans has been added to the java.beans package. Please see XMLEncoder.
